name: Medieval Cultural Quarter Archaeological Assessment (UMAU)
description: The most comprehensive archaeological assessment of medieval Manchester. Contains plans of the three concentric ditch system around the castle/manor promontory, trench plans from 1900, 1983, and 1997 excavations, and evidence for the Hanging Ditch deposits (12th-13th century pottery, animal bone, leather, metalwork).
notes:
UMAU (University of Manchester Archaeological Unit) reports.

Free PDFs available:
- Vol 1 (Main Report): https://chethamsschoolofmusic.com/app/uploads/sites/2/2016/09/Part-1-Text.pdf
- Vol 1 (Illustrations): https://stollerhall.com/app/uploads/sites/2/2016/09/Part-2-Cover-Ills-1-16.pdf
- Vol 2 (Appendices): https://chethamsschoolofmusic.com/app/uploads/sites/2/2016/09/Vol-2-Text.pdf

Key content for digitisation:
- Plans at 1:2000 scale showing ditch system
- Location maps of excavation trenches
- Section drawings of inner rock-cut ditch (10m wide, 4m deep)
- Evidence for middle ditch (5m wide) and outer ditch (3-4m wide, 1-2m deep)
- Discussion of whether ditches relate to Norman castle or Saxon burh
